Key Match Events: India played out a goalless draw against Mauritius in their Intercontinental Cup 2024 opener
Manolo Marquez praised the centre-back pairing of Chinglensana Singh and Rahul Bheke, saying the duo played an important role in keeping a clean sheet against the Mauritians
Pre-Game Insights: Manolo Marquez does not compromise defence for his attacking style of football
The Indian men's national football team ushers in a new era with the familiar face of Manolo Marquez at the helm
Post-Match Reflections: Manolo Marquez termed his managerial debut for India as a “boring game”, saying that the team created no chances throughout the 90 minutes
After a lengthy injury gap, Chinglensana Singh is back in the national team setup and is raring to rekindle his partnership with Manolo for the first time since their Hyderabad FC days
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the GMC Balayogi Stadium in Hyderabad
The Intercontinental Cup is India's first competitive outing since the 1-2 defeat against Qatar in the 2026 FIFA World Cup second-round qualifier
